info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 1:28PM MDT until August 17 at 4:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Medio Burn Scar in... North Central Santa Fe County in north central New Mexico... * Until 430 PM MDT. * At 128 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Medio Burn Scar. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 1.25 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Forest Road 412, State Road 592, Rio En Medio Road, Rio Nambe downstream to Nambe Pueblo Road 101 and Nambe Reservoir, and Pojoaque Creek to the intersection of State Road 503. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Medio Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Medio Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pojoaque, Rio En Medio in Santa Fe County, Nambe Pueblo, Nambe Lake, Pojoaque Pueblo and Chupadero. This includes the following low water crossings... Old Callejon Road. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Medio fire burn area. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
